Name: Old Fashioned Cocktail (Difford's recipe)
Ingredients: 30 ml Straight rye whiskey (100 proof /50% alc./vol.)
10 ml Demerara/Muscovado/brown sugar syrup (2 sugar to 1 water)
3 drop Saline solution 4:1 (20g sea salt to 80g water)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist.
STRAIN into ice-filled glass (preferably over a large cube or chunk of block ice).
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Achieving balance, ideal dilution and a good chill are essential to the enjoyment of this spirituous sublime classic. Pre-batched bottled version serves 7 people: 315ml (10.5oz) Bourbon 210ml (7oz) Rye 75ml (2½oz) Brown sugar syrup 135ml (4.5oz) Water 48 drops Abbots bitters 18 drops Saline solution Measure ingredients into a 75cl bottle, seal, label, turn bottle a few times to mix and place in refrigerator. Ideally, move into a freezer for 30 minutes prior to serving.
Nutrition: One serving of Old Fashioned Cocktail (Difford's recipe) contains 213 calories
